Title: 39062 - # Things You Never Thought Would Hurt Your Credit Score
Direction: 500 words: Write about 3-6 surprising things that will hurt someone's credit score. Don't go with the obvious, that forgetting to pay bills or using a bunch of credit cards will harm your credit score. The audience is people who already know credit score basics, so give them interesting items, like not paying traffic tickets or having no loans at all. The anchor text will fit in any section, as long as the reference to paying off debt works with the section naturally.

Title: 39063 - Pay Off These # Debts First
Direction: 500 words: List 3-6 debts that people should focus on paying off first when they want to get out of debt. Keep in mind that these might not be specific debts like credit card debt; instead, focus on concepts like the debts with the highest interest, or the ones that are hurting credit scores most. This article is for people who want to be responsible and get out of debt, but may not know where to begin if their debt is too big. The anchor text will naturally fit into any section.

Title: 39064 - # Ways to Enjoy Life and Stay on Budget
Direction: 500 words: List 3-6 ways someone can still enjoy simple luxuries in life while staying on budget. Sometimes people think that staying on budget means giving up on the fun things in life. Provide ways people can have fun for free or without spending a lot of money. Ideas can include finding out when their local museums offer free admission days and making their own coffee instead of buying out. Your audience consists of people trying to enjoy life and be financially responsible. Work in the target URL by discussing that one way people tackle debt is cutting out luxuries in their life.

Title: 39065 - # Ways to Make Extra Spending Money This Month
Direction: 500 words: List 3-6 ways someone can make some extra spending money. Focus on ideas that can immediately offer money in one month instead of ideas that take a long time to make money. Ideas can include side jobs such as getting paid to run errands and or simple tasks like recycling. The potential audience is interested in making money and reducing debt. You can include the client link when discussing how small changes in your daily life can help you save extra money.
